div.pre: 2143 Gela, 1883 (1093) Burial: c. 320 B.C.? (K) Contents: 198 AV. Pot hoard with jewelry Philip II: 150 (42) st. Alexander III: 7 (2) st. Carthage: 40 (10) st. (prob. Jenkins-Lewis Grp. III) Flamininus: 1 st. Disposition: Berlin 1 (Flamininus) BullNumSfrag 2 (1884), p. 63 Friedländer, ZfN 1885, p. 2 Jenkins-Lewis, Carthage, p. 59, no. XIV The higher figures given above are de- scribed as a rumor; those in paren- theses are noted by Friedländer The bulk of the hd. suggests a date of burial c. 320 B.C.; the stater of Fla- mininus minted more than a century later is an anomaly
